Mark Baker wrote:

> The point is that you can't interpret the initial PUT request as "set
> state=off and temp=0".  It just means "state=off", and the server is
> free to do what it wants with "temp".  At least, that's how I
> understand it.

We've been through this in APP land recently without coming to 
consensus. My continued belief (not shared by all) is that the specified 
PUT request means state="off" and there is no temp value.

If the server doesn't like that, it should generate an HTTP 40x error 
and refuse the request rather than trying to error correct.
